ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Introductory Italian in a variety of subjects, including weather, hobbies, clothing/shopping, food/dining, family, etc. We learned four verb tenses, adjectives, and articles.
Very good base knowledge of Italian vocab and grammar.
I developed a great basic knowledge of the italian language and introductory knowledge of the grammar and rules of the language

I gained a really good basic understanding of Italian. I have a strong grasp on a lot of grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation. I have a wide range of vocab at my disposal now and a lot of confidence in forming my own sentences and writing.
Basic speaking, writing and reading skills in Italian
Speaking and understanding basic/fundamental Italian
I gained a basic knowledge or Italian. We learned a lot of vocab and grammar and I feel like I can read and write basic Italian fairly well now.
I developed basic italian reading and writing skills
I learned numerous fundamental skills in reading, writing, and speaking the Italian language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was a great class! I actually really enjoyed the daily quizzes as they forced me to stay on top of the material and use most if not all of what I learned. There were moments when this class felt like it was going so fast, however, that it was difficult to truly internalize all its content.
Great instructor and engagement in class. Learning by talking in class and applying the concepts. Could be improved by laying out the grammar concepts a little clearer in class.
this was an amazing course and i really like the way it was taught, very organized and efficient but also fun

This class is very strong in the range of material covered and the speed with which we learned it. The everyday quizzes are tough in workload but very conducive to fast learning. Also, because you meet every day, you get very close with your classmates and there are very low stakes in terms of making errors or not knowing how to say something. One weakness of class is that you move on from material very quickly, which makes it hard to remember vocab a few weeks down the line.

Daily lessons are really good for constant learning of vocab.
Where I stood on grading was unclear until very late in the semester.

This course has daily quizzes which I thought were helpful but were sometimes unpredictable. The class had great energy though sometimes doing the same thing every say got a bit monotonous. Also Michael does not hand anything back in a reasonable amount of time.

This course is very hands-on, practicing the language daily. Only speaking in Italian helps immensely in practicing understanding the language. A way to improve this course for me personally would be to focus more on sentence structure: things like where to place modifiers, etc.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! The Italian department is so wonderful!
Yes! Italian department is fantastic and Michael was an amazing professor. Learned a good amount of Italian for a L1 class.
most definitely, it was the most engaging and effective way to learn elementary level italian

Yes! This class is a great balance of work and more relaxed learning. Out of all of my friends' experiences in other language departments, I would say that I had the most positive. We cover a lot of material but in a way that feels very manageable. Tests are spaced out nicely in a way that helps you remember the material but don't add too much pressure. I love this class!! Definitely take it!
Yes, Italian is a great language and the department is really nice.
Yes. I would definitely recommend it someone wanting to learn Italian for the very first time.
Yeah definitely. Italian is a fun language and Michael is a fun guy if a bit unorganized.
Yes! Michael Farina made a 5-days-a-week 9:25 a.m. Italian class more fun than I thought it could ever be. I learned so much along the way too!
